intro: Mesembryanthemum montis-moltkei, commonly known as the Moltke's ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers that open in response to light. The plant has a sprawling growth habit, often forming dense mats on rocky soils. Its leaves are typically bluish-green with a waxy coating, aiding in water retention. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, which bloom in late spring and early summer.
